intro: Heynea trijuga, commonly known as the three-angled mahogany, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It is valued for its durable, aromatic wood, which is used in furniture and cabinetry. The species also has medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
